entries.content: When offering the prospect the option to hang up, if they don't immediately, ask: 'Well, you got to go first.'
entries.notes: Used after the 'hang up or 30 seconds' opener if the prospect hesitates or is silent after saying no.

entries.content: Use the prospect's likely negative perception of your industry/call type to open, then probe why they feel that way.
entries.notes: Example: 'If I told you this was about recruitment, would a little piece of you die?' followed by 'Why does everybody say that?'

entries.content: If a prospect still declines, ask: 'Last question then, is there any particular reason why?'
entries.notes: A direct probe to understand the root cause of disinterest after other attempts.

entries.content: Constantly give the prospect the feeling of an exit, but delay it, making it easier for them to keep talking.
entries.notes: Phrases like 'before you hang up', 'one last thing', 'before I let you go' create perceived control for the prospect.

focus_area: Handling "Not Interested": Probe softly, diagnose if disinterest or timing
